stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains a similarity between ethnic conflicts in Yugoslavia in the 1990s and previous ethnic conflicts in the Balkans in the early twentieth century?

features.html: The following question refers to the topic of nationalism and ethnic conflict in the postwar period.

choicesHtml: Both conflicts had as a major cause attempts by the Serbian government to expand Serbian influence into neighboring areas with Serbian minorities.
Both conflicts triggered major European wars, as great powers intervened on opposite sides of the conflicts.
Both conflicts were enabled by the weakening of ideologies that had tended to counter feelings of ethnic solidarity.
Both conflicts were in effect proxy wars between rival powers who wished to avoid open confrontation with one another.
